subject: Re: Notes on spreadsheet
preview: Ah, sorry. The chain seemes to have dropped off. It was in reference to Joels email that said…  On Progress - When an SKU is assigned to an order but needs to be moved to another status such as reti

full_threads.body:
Ah, sorry. The chain seemes to have dropped off. It was in reference to Joels email that said…

On Progress - When an SKU is assigned to an order but needs to be moved to another status such as retire / repair, when the status is changed, it still stays assigned to the order unless we play around in the back end. For example, the guys deliver something to a property, and it was damaged, we cannot return the item unless it was in processing. This would mean we need to play around with the status between the front and back end. I am trying to avoid anyone going into the back end. Is there a simple way to do this from the front end? - Missing and Sell is not showing on catalogue view. Please add.

Kind Regards,

Amy + The Team at Huntley + Co



E. AMY@HUNTLEYANDCO.COM.AU

P. 02 8310 2285
W. HUNTLEYANDCO.COM.AU

Hello,

Hope you're well.

Just checking if the last point in this email has been actioned yet?

Thank you.

Kind Regards,

Amy Smith

AMY SMITH

CEO + CREATIVE DIRECTOR



E. AMY@HUNTLEYANDCO.COM.AU

P. 02 8310 2285
W. HUNTLEYANDCO.COM.AU

Kind Regards

Amy Smith

AMY SMITH
CEO + CREATIVE DIRECTOR

P. 02 8310 2285
W. HUNTLEYANDCO.COM.AU

Hi Amy,

We have made some updates to the site. Please see the attached. 

Can we show what the product is when the SKU is entered (i.e. SKU is valid - then say what the product name is) as this will help double check we have the correct item!
- DONE
Sell is not showing as an option on the SKU Update. Please add.
- DONE
Also, I am not sure why this message pops up when I change the SKU of a product to available!
- DONE

On Progress
- When an SKU is assigned to an order but needs to be moved to another status such as retire / repair, when the status is changed, it still stays assigned to the order unless we play around in the back end. For example, the guys deliver something to a property, and it was damaged, we cannot return the item unless it was in processing. This would mean we need to play around with the status between the front and back end. I am trying to avoid anyone going into the back end. Is there a simple way to do this from the front end?
- Missing and Sell is not showing on catalogue view. Please add.

Hello,

I am meeting with the team tomorrow and would appreciate an update on this asap please.

Thank you.

Kind Regards,

Amy Smith

AMY SMITH

CEO + CREATIVE DIRECTOR



E. AMY@HUNTLEYANDCO.COM.AU

P. 02 8310 2285
W. HUNTLEYANDCO.COM.AU

Thank you.

Kind Regards

Amy Smith

AMY SMITH
CEO + CREATIVE DIRECTOR

W. HUNTLEYANDCO.COM.AU

From: Amy Smith <amy@huntleyandco.com.au <mailto:amy@huntleyandco.com.au>>
Date: Thursday, 20 October 2022 at 10:38 am
To: Wolf IQ Support <support@wolfiq.com.au <mailto:support@wolfiq.com.au>>
Subject: SKU Report



Hello,



Thanks for the video and sorry for the late reply.



Phil and I have done some testing have a few queries:



When an SKU is assigned to an order but needs to be moved to another status such as retire / repair, when the status is changed, it still stays assigned to the order unless we play around in the back end. For example, the guys deliver something to a property, and it was damaged, we cannot return the item unless it was in processing. This would mean we need to play around with the status between the front and back end. I am trying to avoid anyone going into the back end. Is there a simple way to do this from the front end?


Can we show what the product is when the SKU is entered (i.e. SKU is valid – then say what the product name is) as this will help double check we have the correct item!
<image004.png>

Sell is not showing as an option on the SKU Update. Please add.
<image005.png>

Missing and Sell is snot showing on catalogue view. Please add.
<image006.png>





Also, I am not sure why this message pops up when I change the SKU of a product to available!
<image007.png>





Thank you!



Kind Regards,

Amy Smith



AMY SMITH

CEO + CREATIVE DIRECTOR

<image008.png>

From: Amy Smith <amy@huntleyandco.com.au>
Date: Thursday, 20 October 2022 at 10:38 am
To: Wolf IQ Support <support@wolfiq.com.au>
Subject: SKU Report



Hello,



Thanks for the video and sorry for the late reply.



Phil and I have done some testing have a few queries:



1. When an SKU is assigned to an order but needs to be moved to another
status such as retire / repair, when the status is changed, it still stays
assigned to the order unless we play around in the back end. For example,
the guys deliver something to a property, and it was damaged, we cannot
return the item unless it was in processing. This would mean we need to
play around with the status between the front and back end. I am trying to
avoid anyone going into the back end. Is there a simple way to do this from
the front end?



1. Can we show what the product is when the SKU is entered (i.e. SKU is
valid – then say what the product name is) as this will help double check
we have the correct item!

[image: Graphical user interface, application Description automatically
generated]

1. Sell is not showing as an option on the SKU Update. Please add.

[image: Graphical user interface, application Description automatically
generated]

1. Missing and Sell is snot showing on catalogue view. Please add.

[image: Graphical user interface, application Description automatically
generated]





1. Also, I am not sure why this message pops up when I change the SKU of
a product to available!

[image: Graphical user interface, application Description automatically
generated]





Thank you!



Kind Regards,

Amy Smith



AMY SMITH

*CEO + CREATIVE DIRECTOR*

Hello,

Thanks for the video and sorry for the late reply.

Phil and I have done some testing have a few queries:


  1. When an SKU is assigned to an order but needs to be moved to another status such as retire / repair, when the status is changed, it still stays assigned to the order unless we play around in the back end. For example, the guys deliver something to a property, and it was damaged, we cannot return the item unless it was in processing. This would mean we need to play around with the status between the front and back end. I am trying to avoid anyone going into the back end. Is there a simple way to do this from the front end?




  1. Can we show what the product is when the SKU is entered (i.e. SKU is valid - then say what the product name is) as this will help double check we have the correct item!





  1. Sell is not showing as an option on the SKU Update. Please add.





  1. Missing and Sell is snot showing on catalogue view. Please add.





  1. Also, I am not sure why this message pops up when I change the SKU of a product to available!




Thank you!

Kind Regards,

Amy Smith
